function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Real-time public communications mostly in Mandarin Chinese and sign language, limited communication in different languages for non-Taiwanese citizens","Impact":"Limited access to critical health information for non-Mandarin speakers, increased risk of misinformation and lack of awareness","Mitigation":"Establish multi-language communication channels, provide translated information, and use visual aids for sign language communication","Technologies":"Translation software, visual communication tools, multilingual websites","People":"Non-Taiwanese citizens, travelers, and residents in Taiwan","Owner":"Taiwanese government, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Permitting the docking of the Diamond Princess cruise ship with confirmed infections onboard, leading to public panic and concern about community spread","Impact":"Temporary public panic, potential for community spread, increased risk of infection for the population","Mitigation":"Enhanced screening for incoming ships, quarantine measures for passengers with confirmed infections, and transparent communication with the public","Technologies":"Virus testing technology, quarantine facilities, public health communication platforms","People":"General public, passengers on the cruise ship, residents of Keelung and New Taipei City","Owner":"Taiwanese government, port authorities, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Uncertainty about the sustainability of intensive public health policies and public reception until the end of the epidemic","Impact":"Risk of policy fatigue, potential decrease in public compliance, and reduced effectiveness of control measures","Mitigation":"Continuous public education, engagement, and monitoring of public sentiment, adaptation of policies based on evolving situations","Technologies":"Social media monitoring tools, public sentiment analysis software, real-time health data analytics","People":"General public, policymakers, public health officials","Owner":"Taiwanese government, public health authorities"}]}
